alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 21 at 10:39PM MDT until June 22 at 1:45AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Elbert County in east central Colorado... * Until 145 AM MDT. * At 1039 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Elbert County This includes the following streams and drainages... West Bijou Creek, Water Gulch, East Bijou Creek, Reed Springs Creek, Middle Bijou Creek and Wilson Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
